bibl.title: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to F. Irvine Burnham, November 1, 1930

div1.p: [Carter] encloses a check for Burnham's work on the maps for the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to F. Irvine Burnham, November 1, 1930
div1.opener:
Book. Miscl
maps
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
November 1, 1930.
Mr. F. Irvine Burnham,
Department of State, Room 395,
Washington, D. C.
My Dear Mr. Burnham:
div1.p:
I have the honor to herewith enclose check for $125.00
to your order, as per your statement of September 25, 1930, to
Dr. Wade H. Frost, also herewith enclosed. The Comptroller of the
Rockefeller Foundation, considered the voucher for the maps to
come under my immediate jurisdiction, hence included the money
for the maps in a check just received by me.

I will appreciate it, however, if you sign the acknowledgement
of the receipt of the check, which is typed at the bottom of your enclosed
statement of September 25, 1930, and send it to Dr. Frost, in the
stampted and addressed envelope, also herewith enclosed. This, in
order that he may complete his statement of expenses.

With best wishes to yourself and your family, and hoping
that you all are well, I remain.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, 3 enclosures.
In case you mislay the envelope, Dr. Frost's address is
School of Hygiene and Public Health,
615 North Wolfe Street,
Baltimore, Maryland.
